{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Actiontec |model=C3000A |fcc_date=03/09/2018 |manuf_country=China |is_manuf=No |type=wireless router |fcc_id=LNQC3000A |ic_id=2496A-C3000A |us_id=LNQDL01AC3000A |pwr_v=12 |pwr_amp=2 |pwr_conn=barrel |cpu1_brand=Broadcom |cpu1_model=BCM63139 |cpu1_cspeed=1 GHz |cpu1_cores=2 |fla1_brand=Macronix |ram1_brand=Nanya |expansion_if_types=USB 2.0, |expansion_usb_num=1 |wi1_chip1_brand=Broadcom |wi1_chip1_model=BCM4366E |wi1_802dot11_protocols=an+ac |wi1_ant_conn=U.FL |wi1_txchains=4 |wi1_rxchains=4 |wi1_sstreams=4 |wi2_chip1_brand=Broadcom |wi2_chip1_model=BCM4365E |wi2_802dot11_protocols=bgn |wi2_ant_conn=U.FL |wi2_txchains=3 |wi2_rxchains=3 |wi2_sstreams=3 |eth_cpu=true |sw_cpu=true |lan_speed=1G |lan_ports=4 |wan_ports=1 |flags=DFS, ADSL2+, VDSL2, |stock_os=Linux;3.4.11-rt19; |802dot11_protocols=abgn+ac |default_ip=192.168.0.1 }}
:• '''1733''' Mbps - 4SS 5GHz [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_802.11ac#Data_rates_and_speed 802.11ac] (80MHz chan.), :• '''600''' Mbps - 3SS 2.4GHz [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_802.11n-2009#Data_rates 802.11n] (40MHz chan., 256QAM) = '''''2400 Mbps'' class'''
{{TagLine|802.11ac Wi-Fi Router}} According to a [https://fccid.io/LNQC3000A/Letter/Product-Similarity-Declaration-3775358 Declaration of Similarity] document submitted to the FCC, :"Models C3000A and T3260 are identical in hardware design. The purpose for 2 model numbers is to clarify specifically for one large :customer versus generic consumer products." Per marketplace (eBay) labels, CenturyLink branded variants of the C3000A seem to use CenturyLinkXXXX and CenturyLinkXXXX-5G SSIDS. Chip IDs are not legible in the FCC internal photos so they are just a guess. *{{WiFiCert|WFA75151|01/25/2018}} {{see also|Actiontec R3000|Actiontec}} ===See also=== :FCC ID: [https://fccid.io/LNQ LNQ] • [https://www.wi-fi.org/product-finder-results?sort_by=certified&sort_order=desc&keywords=Actiontec ''Wi-Fi CERTIFIED products by Actiontec''] *[[Actiontec C3000A]]/[[Actiontec T3260]] -
